page.title: 05Clubs and groups in Cowlinge
page.content: In Cowlinge there is a branch of the Womens' Institute, which meets once a month in the Village Hall. It draws members from the neighbouring village of Lidgate. The womens' branch of the British Legion meets fortnightly and also includes members from adjacent villages. There is a childrens music club and an adult choir which gives recitals and concerts regularly in the village church. There is an active Boy cout Troop as well. Summertime brings the village fete, and an assortment of coffee mornings and plant sales etc. all profits to the upkeep of the church or village hall. The public houses is the headquarters of the darts teams for men and women, dominoes and crib are played here most evenings.
